text: Sisyphus (, Sísyphos) was a legendary person in Greek mythology. "Sisyphean," Oxford English Dictionary, 3rd ed., 2001; retrieved 2012-3-29. According to the ancient story, Sisyphus was forced to roll a big rock up a hill, but it rolled back down and the task was never finished.Littell, Robert S. (1849). The Living Age, Vol. 20, p. 53. He was forced to repeat this over and over again forever.Mythweb.com, "Sisyphus" ; retrieved 2012-3-29.The word "Sisyphean", which relates to a task which is undertaken with great effort but is ultimately pointless, is derived from the myth. ==References== ==Other websites== * "Sisyphus," Encyclopædia Britannica, 11th ed.
